intro: Lolium interruptum, commonly known as slender ryegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and western Asia, and is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. The plant has slender, upright stems with narrow leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. It is a cool-season annual or biennial, typically blooming in spring and early summer. Lolium interruptum is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open areas, making it both a weed and a forage species.
